title: Researching multilingualism, multilingualism in research practice.
abstractText:
This project has been funded under the ESRC Researcher Development Initiative scheme (Round 4) from May 2010 - April 2013.  It is based in the MOSAIC Centre for Research on Multilingualism, School of Education, University of Birmingham. Dr Deirdre Martin (PI) and Professor Marilyn Martin-Jones with members of the Centre direct the project.

Aims:

  • Provide advanced research training and development activities related to multilingualism.
  • Encourage application of well-established research methods from sociolinguistic studies of multilingualism to other social science disciplines, particularly education.
  • Develop dedicated research training materials and facilitate international dialogue among researchers running research methodology courses for postgraduate students researching in multilingual contexts.

Events include:

  • A five-day residential course: Researching multilingualism: key concepts, methods and issues (University of Birmingham, July 2010 and April 2011).
  • Follow-up support days.
  • A workshop: Transcribing bilingual discourse at the ESRC Centre for Research on Bilingualism (Bangor University).
  • One-day regional workshops on specific themes (at the Universities of Birkbeck, Cardiff, Goldsmiths, Leeds, Strathclyde).
  • 2 master-classes.
  • Ongoing development of specialist research training materials.
  • A final conference.

For sustainability, project activities are embedded within the UK Linguistic Ethnography Forum (special interest group, British Association for Applied Linguistics).
